intro: Zeuxine africana, commonly known as the African zigzag plant, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Zeuxine africana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
